name: Mercure Milano Centro

reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: This is a very nice small hotel with a great location and very nice, large rooms. It is very near the subway stop and in a neighborhood with some nice restaurants.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was comfortable , nicely decorated , clean and the bathroom was very good. Everything worked and the room was well lit .
reviews.title: good hotel in great location

reviews.text: The room has tea, coffee and a kettle. We had a side room which looked onto another building and was very quiet at night.
reviews.title: Super choice

likes.liked: — Extremely nicely decorated room - more hotels in this class should be like this
likes.disliked: — Limitations with internet and attitude of one of the staff when using the public terminal

reviews.text: Breakfast was good ,they even had soya milk. All the staff were pleasant and helpful . the reception staff spoke good English. The location is excellent very near a metro station , and there are some nice restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Superb value for money, and a pleasant surprise

likes.liked: — Sleeping so well, and having a clean, non-smoking bedroom.

reviews.text: We bought day tickets for the metro which can be used on the trams and buses as well , good value and easy to use.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean hotel just outside the main city centre. The hotel entrance is just steps away from the Piazza Oberdan metro spot, and then you are a couple of metro stops from the Duomo. Often we simply walked back to the hotel (also at night), as it was 10-15 minutes to the sites in the centre of town. The area around the hotel was busy but nice.
reviews.title: Clean Efficient Hotel

likes.liked: — access by car to central Milan / price
likes.disliked: — Use the parking garage recommended by the hotel if you have a car

reviews.text: Our room literally faced the main street and the metro entrance, but the window was well insulated and the airconditioning was quiet. The rooms are small, but well appointed and the bathroom is new/modern and very clean.
reviews.title: Great location, nice view

reviews.text: Breakfast was good/ staff is efficient and helpful (provided us with a small Eyewitness travel guide to Milan, which was an excerpt from the main travel guide).
reviews.title: Very nice!!!

likes.disliked: — There was a Nestle coffee machine in the breakfast, no expresso

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for only 1 night, wanting a quick in/out of Milan, and used the parking garage recommended by the hotel 23 Euro for 24 hours. The garage attendant delivered the car to the hotel entrance and we easily loaded the luggage and were in/out of Milan without any hassle.
reviews.title: Very efficient staff!

reviews.text: Good value for the price, as hotels in Milan can be expensive.
reviews.title: Perfectly located and Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel at a discount rate and were pleasantly surprised, it was modern, clean and comfortable. The room and bathroom were quite small but had everything you could want. The buffet breakfast was lovely with lots of choice. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was in walking distance of the Duomo.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a good location for the price we paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just spent a weekend (Nov 9 through 12) at this hotel. Overall I would recommend it if one can obtain a discount rate. The posted rate of 260Euros per couple seems excessive. Its a small hotel and while not exuding charm it is functional and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Recommend the Mercure Centro at discount rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room while relatively small was perfectly adequate with a writing desk and in-room WiFi at 8Euro for 24 hours which is better than average in my experience for European hotels. The room may have been recently upgraded as it had a closet, doors and windows of white laminate in good condition. Some may consider laminate to be cheap but I personally prefer it to beaten down wood masquerading as antique. The bathroom was a very decent size with toilet, bidet and sink plus full size bath with a shower option. The water pressure was excellent and the water hot; one has the normal issue of shower spray getting on the bathroom floor, but it was relatively minor and better than many hotels. The buffer breakfast while not spectacular was certainly adequate with a variety of cereals, cheese, fruit (tinned), bacon, toast and rolls.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, loved this hotel
Decent Choice
reviews.text: We found the location in Piazza Venetia to be good, the hotel is about 10 yards from a red line Metro station which takes one directly to the Duomo and connects with one change to the Centrale Stazione. (a total of I think of five stops). There are also a number of trams that pass directly in front of the hotel. We like to walk and if one didn't want to take the Metro it was about a 20 to 30 minute walk to the Duomo and the main shopping quadrangle which is just off Corso Venezia directly off the hotel. It is 30 minutes walk from the restaurants in the Brera area. It isn't in the dead center of the activity so if walking or public transport isn't appealing this may not be the ideal hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would give this hotel good marks (at a discounted rate) however, there are a couple of items people should be aware of. We had a room at the front (facing a very busy Piazza) and in general the street noise didn't bother us, however, one can hear the trams running as background noise , it's not obtrusive but it is there. In addition there was a regular deep rumbling from somewhere, possibly the Metro; again it wasn't troublesome but some people may be bothered by it.
reviews.title: OK - but not worth a 4 star price....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel really was excellent. I chose to stay here based upon the other reviews left on this site. I really was impressed - my girlfriend and i stayed here for three days. The hotel is in a great location, 15 mins walk from the Duomo, close to parks and restaurants with the metro station literally right in front of the hotel. The hotel was exceptionally clean everywhere and well air conditioned, our room was big enough with a huge bed - once again completely spotless. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody wishing to visit Milan and stay in a comfortable, clean hotel, in a great location at a very reasonable price. Excellent stay had, very pleased.
reviews.title: Superb hotel for visiting Milan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very modern and clean hotel located in the City Centre. Staff very friendly and offer help when needed.
reviews.title: Nice value for Luxury Hotel

likes.liked: — Cleaness and modern with low value

reviews.title: Loved the Mercure Milano Centro
reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much, since Mercure is Accor's budget chain. I was very surprised. This was a pretty, modern, and extremely friendly hotel which was very well located. i walked to the Duomo twice (I LIKE to walk -- it is two metro stops away otherwise).

The staff goes out of their way to assist you in every way, the laundry service is very efficient, it has a cozy little breakfast room, also has a small but popular bar with very good bartenders and an extended happy hour.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

likes.disliked: — It doesn't look as good on the outside as it does inside, it is generic hotel accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you aren't carying your laptop, free internet in the lobby is provided.
reviews.title: Disappointing

description: Situated in an historical palace of the old Milan of the XIX th Century and completely renewed in 2005, The Hotel Mercure Milano Centro Porta Venezia is located in the City center.30 elegant rooms furnished with precious interior design, welcome thebusinessmen and the tourists in the real heart of the City, a few steps from the Duomo Cathedral and from the most important Fashion Streets.
